name: Mitigation Playbook for PowerShell Script Execution Incident
description: This playbook addresses an incident where an attacker executed PowerShell scripts remotely on a compromised workstation, designed to download additional payloads and exfiltrate sensitive data.

action--ca5b6e43-33c2-43c8-849d-26378e2f.name: Kill malicious process
action--ca5b6e43-33c2-43c8-849d-26378e2f.description: Terminate the malicious PowerShell script process.

action--b4bbf3dd-e9f3-4ff1-bdb5-f51e507e.name: Isolate compromised host
action--b4bbf3dd-e9f3-4ff1-bdb5-f51e507e.description: Isolate the host to prevent further intrusion.

commands.command: if iptables -L | grep DROP; then echo 'Host is already isolated'; else iptables -A INPUT -s 192.168.1.0/24 -j DROP; fi

action--d54666a2-52d2-4c8e-a3f7-a7de1e26.name: Scan and clean system
action--d54666a2-52d2-4c8e-a3f7-a7de1e26.description: Scan for residual malware and clean the system.

commands.command: for file in $(find /tmp -name '*.exe'); do rm -f $file; done

while-condition--8a2876bc-bcfb-482e-ab50.name: Check if the system is clean
while-condition--8a2876bc-bcfb-482e-ab50.description: Repeat cleaning until no malware is detected.
